de.mrapp.android.dialog

Class AbstractMaterialDialog

  • java.lang.Object
    • Dialog
      • de.mrapp.android.dialog.AbstractMaterialDialog
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Dialog, MaterialDialog, MaterialDialogDecorator
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractHeaderDialog

    public abstract class AbstractMaterialDialog
extends Dialog
implements MaterialDialog
    An abstract base class for all dialogs, which are designed according to Android 5's Material design guidelines even on pre-Lollipop devices.
    Since:
    3.2.0

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Modifier Constructor and Description
      protected AbstractMaterialDialog(Context context, int themeResourceId)
      Creates a dialog, which is designed according to Android 5's Material Design guidelines even on pre-Lollipop devices.

    • Constructor Detail

      • AbstractMaterialDialog

        protected AbstractMaterialDialog(@NonNull
                                 Context context,
                                 @StyleRes
                                 int themeResourceId)
        Creates a dialog, which is designed according to Android 5's Material Design guidelines even on pre-Lollipop devices.
        Parameters:
        context - The context, which should be used by the dialog, as an instance of the class Context. The context may not be null
        themeResourceId - The resource id of the theme, which should be used by the dialog, as an Integer value. The resource id must correspond to a valid theme

    • Method Detail

      • onAttachDecorators

        @CallSuper
protected void onAttachDecorators(@NonNull
                                             View view)
        The method, which is invoked when the dialog's decorators should be attached. This method may be overridden by subclasses in order to attach additional decorators.
        Parameters:
        view - The root view of the view hierarchy, which should be modified by the decorators, as an instance of the class View. The view may not be null

      • onDetachDecorators

        @CallSuper
protected void onDetachDecorators()
        The method, which is invoked when the dialog's decorators should be detached. This method must be overridden by subclasses if they attach additional decorators.
